name: Ensure DB2 Scalar Function TIMESTAMP is not used
description: This rule checks the DB2 Scalar Function TIMESTAMP is used in DB2 Database(s).
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: As you decide to migrate from DB2 to PostgreSQL, it is important to note the changes to be taken care of during the migration process. Without adaptation, the SQL script won’t compile on Postgresql, leading to error.
remediation:
TIMESTAMP(<FIELD>) Converts the input into a time value, and it has to be changed to TO_TIMESTAMP (<FIELD>, <format>) in PostgreSQL.
CURRENT TIMESTAMP has to be changed to CURRENT_TIMESTAMP.
sample:
SELECT TIMESTAMP('2006-01-31-22.44.55.000000'),
       TIMESTAMP('2006-01-31-22.44.55.000'),
       TIMESTAMP('2006-01-31-22.44.55'),
       TIMESTAMP('20060131224455'),
       TIMESTAMP('2006-01-31','22.44.55')
FROM SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1;

SELECT CURRENT TIMESTAMP FROM SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1;
total: Number of Artifacts with SQL code

technicalCriteria.name: Database Migration - DB2 Database to PostgreSQL
